word_mean: 斜交于基面和中线面，但垂直于中站面的斜平面与船体型表面的交线。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin diagonalis, from Greek diagōnios 'from angle to angle', from dia 'through' + gōnia 'angle'

entry.def: A diagonal line or movement goes in a sloping direction, for example, from one corner of a square across to the opposite corner.
A diagonal is a line that goes in a sloping direction.

example.ex: The bed linen is patterned in stylish checks, stripes, diagonals and triangles.
example.tran: 床单有漂亮的方格形、条纹、斜纹和三角形图案。

entry.def: In geometry, a diagonal is a straight line that joins two opposite corners in a flat four-sided shape such as a square.

example.ex: Mark five points an equal distance apart along the diagonals.
example.tran: 在对角线上等距地标出5点。

means.word_mean: 1. (geometry) a straight line connecting any two vertices of a polygon that are not adjacent
2. a line or cut across a fabric that is not at right angles to a side of the fabric
3. an oblique line of squares of the same color on a checkerboard;
4. (mathematics) a set of entries in a square matrix running diagonally either from the upper left to lower right entry or running from the upper right to lower left entry
5. a punctuation mark (/) used to separate related items of information
1. at an angle; especially connecting two nonadjacent corners of a plane figure or any two corners of a solid that are not in the same face;
2. having an oblique or slanted direction

stems_affixes.word_buile: dia穿过,二者之间,对着+lect讲+ic→二人对讲→辩证法
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+phan显示+ous……的→对面显示[影子]→透明的
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+gnosis知道→穿过[皮肤]知道→诊断
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+gon角+al物→对着角的线,斜线
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+gram图→交叉对着画→图表
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+lect讲+ic→二人对讲→辩证法
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+logu话+e→对着说话
dia穿过,二者之间,对着+meter测量→对着测量[圆]直径
